intro: Schmaltzia racemulosa, commonly known as the clustered Schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Schmaltzia racemulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in xerophytic gardens.
